content: m i n i - m o n k e y n o s e w f r e e c r o c h e t p a t t e r n @_monchissle_ t e s t e r a p p r e c i a t i o n ❤ t h a n k y o u s o m u c h please support these amazing artists @likealigercrochet @seagullsyarnnest @ira_bernadette @abaana shop @haekel_wand @littlelolitalexey _crochet @_monchissle_ notes this pattern is intermediate level difficulty this pattern is worked in continuous rounds no need to slip_stitch + ch1 to start a new round adjustments to ear/snout/arm/leg/tail placement may be necessary depending on yarn/hook used and gauge this pattern is written in english language using us crochet terminology finished pieces made from this pattern may be sold please credit me monchissle as the designer materials abbreviations yarn in three different colors bobble n - bobble stitch n main color = a accent colors = indicates number b and c used here 8/4 cotton of double_crochet for bobble crochet hook in size cc - color change corresponding to yarn chosen chain - chain used here 2 5mm double_crochet - double_crochet main safety eyes 6mm decrease - decrease invisible color stuffing material accent a fo - fasten_off color tapestry needle half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet b scissors increase - increase stitchmarkers magic_ring - magic_ring optional r - round single_crochet - single_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch accent color c @_monchissle_ start with the head in main color a r1 magic_ring with 6sc 6 r2 6inc 12 r3 1sc 1inc *6 18 in the next round the ears will be crocheted the lower part of the ears will not yet be attached to the body this will happen in round 7 if you are working with thinner yarn/non-fluffy yarn it can be helpful to crochet the first ear as if left-handed this will help to have the ear curve nicely and to have the nice/right side of your crochet facing to the front r4 6sc ch3 optional place a stitch marker in the last chain to help facilitate fixing the ear to the head in r7 in 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet+double_crochet in one stitch 2dc+half_double_crochet in one stitch slip_stitch into same stitch as the last single_crochet of the base round 9sc repeat instructions in 3sc 18 watch a video for crocheting the ears here r5 18sc do not crochet into the slip_stitch from the previous round 18 r6 9sc cc b flo 1hdc 2dc in one stitch *2 1hdc cc a both loops 5sc 20 r7 6sc fix ear with 1sc insert hook through the last stitch of the ch3 from the ear and then through both loops of your next stitch of the head then work a regular single_crochet 2sc cc b 1sc 2dec 1sc cc a 2sc fix ear with 1sc 2sc 18 r8 1sc 1dec *6 12 @_monchissle_ place safety eyes between round 5 & 6 5 stitches apart the
